intro: Gymnolomia parkinsonii f. flaviflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered gymnolomia, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which are typically clustered in inflorescences at the base of the plant. The plant has palmate leaves with lobed margins, and its stems are often hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
